title: Remembering Elson Floyd: Family is appreciative of support
text:
When feelings deep within the human spirit reach out to answer someone else’s needs with gestures of encouragement, caring, love and tenderhearted deeds, they reach far beyond the moment [“ WSU President Elson Floyd was state’s best higher-education advocate ,” Opinion, June 23]. Our family has received your many gifts of kindness and we will be forever grateful.
The last few months have been the most difficult that our family and I have experienced. Elson Floyd’s death has been an unbearable and extremely heartbreaking experience for us.
Thank you for sharing your many expressions of love and support during Elson’s illness. He knew you were there praying and encouraging him. He knew you loved, cared and respected him. He transitioned from this world knowing he was appreciated and admired. Because of you, he knew he had made a difference. Thank you for sharing all of that with him before he left us.
Our family wants you to know we have only been able to get through this devastating time because you have shown us great compassion, love and support.

I know that if Elson were here, personal thank-you notes would have been sent already. Please know I am most sincerely grateful.
Carmento M. Floyd, Pullman
